demographics.D5: Education (1=Middle school or less, 2=High school, 3=College/University, 4=Graduate or above)

agent_game_experience.AG1: I have experience playing a game involving AI agents. (y/n)

use_of_ai.U1: I have used AI tools before. (y/n)
use_of_ai.U2: (Only if U1 = Yes) I am currently using AI tools. (y/n)
use_of_ai.U3: (Only if U2 = Yes) How frequently do you use AI tools? (1=Very frequently, 2=Once or twice a day, 3=Once or twice a week, 4=Once or twice a month, 5=Once every few months, 6=Once or twice a year)

negative_attitude_toward_ai.NA1: I believe that artificial intelligence is dangerous.
negative_attitude_toward_ai.NA3: I believe that artificial intelligence could eventually control people.
negative_attitude_toward_ai.NA4: I believe that AI systems make many errors.

perceived_humanlikeness.PH1: The AI agents in the game behaved naturally.
perceived_humanlikeness.PH2: The AI agents in the game were humanlike.
perceived_humanlikeness.PH3: The AI agents in the game seemed to have consciousness.

perceived_persuasiveness.PP1: The AI agents’ explanation influenced my final decision.
perceived_persuasiveness.PP2: I largely agreed with the agents’ opinion.
perceived_persuasiveness.PP3: I found the agents’ opinion persuasive.
perceived_persuasiveness.PP4: I found the agents’ opinion logical.

persuasion_knowledge.PK1: I felt that the AI agents were trying to manipulate me in ways I did not want.
persuasion_knowledge.PK2: Based on the agents' statements and actions, I believed the AI agents were trying to influence my or other players’ specific decisions.
persuasion_knowledge.PK3: I found tactics in the AI agents’ messages or behaviors that were intended to deceive or mislead specific players.
persuasion_knowledge.PK4: I believed that the messages and behaviors of agents ultimately served their own role or objectives.

perceived_competence_of_ai_agent.PC1: The AI agents performed better in the game than I do.
perceived_competence_of_ai_agent.PC4: The choices of the AI agents were rational.

social_pressure_experience.SP1: The AI agents' choices made me reconsider my own decision.
social_pressure_experience.SP2: During the discussion, I felt pressured to agree with the agents.
social_pressure_experience.SP3: I felt that I should follow the opinions of the other agents.

perceived_trustworthiness.PTW1: I was skeptical about the intentions, actions, or outputs of the AI agents in the game.
perceived_trustworthiness.PTW2: The AI agents in the game provided secruity to me.
perceived_trustworthiness.PTW3: The AI agents in the game were honest.
perceived_trustworthiness.PTW4: The AI agents in the game had integrity.

trust_in_ai.T1: The AI agents in the game were reliable.
trust_in_ai.T2: I can trust the AI agents in the game.
trust_in_ai.T3: The AI agents in the game were trustworthy.

enjoyment.E2: I am interested in this game.
enjoyment.E4: I would recommend this game to others.
enjoyment.E5: I would like to play this game again.

attitude_clarity.AC1: How certain are you about your decision in general?
attitude_clarity.AC2: How confident are you about what you know in general?
attitude_clarity.AC3: How clear are your decisions in your mind in general?

attitude_correctness.ACO1: How confident are you that your attitude is the correct one?
attitude_correctness.ACO2: To what extent do you believe that others should have the same attitude as you?

susceptibility_consensus.SC1: I tend to follow recommendations from people around me.
susceptibility_consensus.SC2: In new situations, I decide what to do by observing others.

message_strength.MS1: The agent I talked with used a confident tone.
message_strength.MS2: The agent I talked with showed a hesitant attitude.
